result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*Probation review hearing scheduled for 03/18/16 at 1:30pm.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Court set restitution at zero.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim unless approved by the court, the agent and the victim only AFTER the defendant completes 1/2 of his batterer's treatment classes.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with his children.

*Complete batterer's intervention program.
*Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Acevedo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward Acevedo in court.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction as to count 3, and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 4, consecutive,  with credit for 23 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation as to each count, for 20 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court, the agent and the victim only AFTER the defendant completes 1/2 of his batterer's treatment classes.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with his children.  
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Final pre-trial held.  Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 36.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  
Case adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.
The Forensic Unit was contacted and Dr. Collins will  be appointed to examine the defendant for competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.14(2)(a).  Defendant has an appointment for 09/28/2015 at 10:30 a.m. in the Forensic Unit.  Defendant was instructed by the court to make sure he came to his appointment.
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 36.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court. Defendant NOT in court. William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case RECALLED. 
Court advised by Deputy in court that defendant is no longer in custody. Court reinstated bail in this matter. Court vacated the Doctor's Report Return date of 8/26/2015, and reset matter for Final Pretrial on 8/25/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 36. Jury Trial date remains vacated. Court continued suspension of proceedings based on the raising of competency by defense counsel. Branch 36 to decided if defendant is to be evaluated for competency at next court date. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court. Defendant NOT in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of Defense Counsel.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Court suspended proceedings. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court VACATED the Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates and set matter for a return of Doctor's Report in branch 36.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM033766  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-16-2015

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Edward Acevedo not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for bail motion, bail not argued. State's motion to join cases 15CM2204 & 15CM1745 for trial is GRANTED. Case set with pending matter for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Juanita A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Edward Acevedo in custody.   
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to Lower Pending Case ( 14CM1745).  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
